questions.text: When my parents suggested going on a camping trip, I wasn’t very (1) ____ on the idea.
questions.explanation: 'Keen on' means interested or enthusiastic. The text says he wasn’t very interested at first.

questions.text: But when we arrived at the campsite, I quickly (2) ____ my mind.
questions.explanation: 'Changed my mind' is the common idiomatic expression.

questions.text: …a small shop that sold everything we could possibly (3) ____.
questions.explanation: 'Need' is the most natural word in this context.

questions.text: I realised it was actually quite (4) ____ to be away from technology for a while.
questions.explanation: 'Refreshing' fits the context of enjoying time away from technology.

questions.text: It was amazing to see so many different birds and (5) ____ insects in their natural habitat.
questions.explanation: The text highlights the variety and rarity of the insects, so 'rare' is correct.

questions.text: We also went swimming in the river, which was surprisingly (6) ____ despite the early morning chill.
questions.explanation: 'Refreshing' is correct because it conveys a pleasantly cold feeling.

questions.text: During the evenings, we played board games and sang songs together, which made the experience even more (7) ____.
questions.explanation: 'Enjoyable' fits the positive feeling described in the text.

questions.text: On the last day, I felt sad to leave because the trip had been unexpectedly (8) ____ and had created memories we would always treasure.
questions.explanation: 'Fun' is correct; the trip was enjoyable and memorable.
